ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: First time using short stories, films, poems, and anecdotes to learn new vocabulary and grammar structures. A great contrast to earlier levels that are solely textbook learning. Continued development of spoken Chinese and listening comprehension. Less focus on reading and writing.
Improved my proficiency in Chinese, mainly my listening and speaking skills.
Through this course I was able to learn more advanced descriptors and idioms in Chinese. Through our many speaking practices, I also developed more natural speaking abilities.
I learned so much about both Chinese language and culture through this class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Ao Laoshi is the sweetest teacher ever; you can tell she really cares about her students and their improvement in the language. I think this was the main strength of the course. Ao Laoshi was always very attentive, making sure we were participating and learning from the course. The only weakness is that at times it felt a little disorganized. For example, the lesson number on the syllabus would not match the lesson number on the actual lesson page, causing some confusion and miscommunication among students at times. Otherwise, this was a great course!

This course is an amazing transition to high level, themed Chinese courses. The topic of films and stories kept me engaged and helped with retaining more vocab and grammar. I did not notice any weaknesses.
I thought the method of instruction was great because there was regular language practice and assessment, but there was never significant pressure to perform on overly frequent assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if you speak Chinese and want to keep speaking Chinese.
If you're dedicated to improving your Chinese language skills, then I'd certainly recommend this course!
I would recommend this course to any student on track to completing the Chinese language certificate.
I think this class is a great tool to advance Chinese language skills because it focuses on good practice and less on assignments everyday.
